subject: HTML
question:
Write what pseudo-class applies for the given description:

1. :_ --> Matches any input, select and textarea that does not have "required" attribute.
2. :_ --> Matches any input, select and textarea that has "required" attribute.
3. :_ --> Matches any input, select and textarea that does not have "disabled" attribute.
4. :_ --> Matches any input, select and textarea that has "disabled" attribute.
5. :_ --> Matches any radio button and checkbox that has been checked by the user.
6. :_ --> Matches any radio button and checkbox that was checked by default when the page loaded, even if the user has unchecked it.
7. :_ --> Matches any input, select and textarea that has been filled out with the valid characters.
8. :_ --> Matches any input, select and textarea that is required but does not have any text or that has a text but does not meet the content requirement.
9. :_ --> pseudo-classes represents input elements whose current value is inside the range limits specified by the min and max attributes.
10. :_ --> pseudo-classes represents input elements whose current value is outside the range limits specified by the min and max attributes. An element out of range also matches the :invalid pseudo-class.
11. :_ --> pseudo-element that represents an input and textarea that is not editable by the user.
12. :_ --> pseudo-element that represents an input and textarea that is editable by the user.
13. :_ --> matches input and textarea elements that support and currently have the placeholder attribute, and still have the placeholder showing because the value of the element is still empty.
answer:
1. :optional --> Matches any input, select and textarea that does not have "required" attribute.
2. :required --> Matches any input, select and textarea that has "required" attribute.
3. :enabled --> Matches any input, select and textarea that does not have "disabled" attribute.
4. :disabled --> Matches any input, select and textarea that has "disabled" attribute.
5. :checked --> Matches any radio button and checkbox that has been checked by the user.
6. :default --> Matches any radio button and checkbox that was checked by default when the page loaded, even if the user has unchecked it.
7. :valid --> Matches any input, select and textarea that has been filled out with the valid characters.
8. :invalid --> Matches any input, select and textarea that is required but does not have any text or that has a text but does not meet the content requirement.
9. :in-range --> pseudo-classes represents input elements whose current value is inside the range limits specified by the min and max attributes.
10. :out-range --> pseudo-classes represents input elements whose current value is outside the range limits specified by the min and max attributes. An element out of range also matches the :invalid pseudo-class.
11. :read-only --> pseudo-element that represents an input and textarea that is not editable by the user.
12. :read-write --> pseudo-element that represents an input and textarea that is editable by the user.
13. :placeholder-shown --> matches input and textarea elements that support and currently have the placeholder attribute, and still have the placeholder showing because the value of the element is still empty.
